Explanation: Explanation: Machine tools must be tough enough to withstand these both in order to provide stability against downward pressure and to perform the job more accurately.

Question: 8. Carbides are used in_____
Option C: c) rapid stock removal and higher speed both
Explanation: Explanation: Carbides are used for these both reasons. But they are not used for comparatively small jobs.

Question: 9. “Light finishing cuts in expensive forming tools”- this quality is applicable to_____
Explanation: Explanation: The answer should be none of mentioned. This is the quality of carbon steel.

Question: 10. Which of the following is easy to grind and generally used for intermittent cut?
Explanation: Explanation: High speed steel has some advanced quality and so it is very accurate even on small diameters. So it is easy to grind high speed steel. Again, this high speed steel is generally used for intermittent cut.

Question: 1. “High compressive strength with negative rake” – this is applicable to_____
Explanation: Explanation: This is the quality of carbides. That’s why they are not suitable for very small diameters.

Question: 2. Which of the following tool material has excessive wear?
Option C: c) carbon steel and high speed steel both
Explanation: Explanation: These both materials have excessive wear. They have excessive wear on castings and hard materials.

Question: 4. Which of the following is not the use of diamond?
Option B: b) suitable for cutting hard metals
Explanation: Explanation: Diamond is not used for rapid stock removal. For rapid stock removal, carbides and ceramics are used.

Question: 5. For general purpose, which type of cutting tool is used in lathe?
Explanation: Explanation: For general purpose, single point cutting tool is used. Like both shaper and planer are single point cutting tool that only cut in straight line.

Question: 6. For specific purpose, which type of cutting tool is used in lathe?
Explanation: Explanation: For specific purpose, multi point cutting tool is used. Milling and drilling are generally multi point cutting tool.

Question: 8. Which of the following is not the type of cutting tool material?
Explanation: Explanation: The answer should be none of the mentioned. All are the types of cutting tool material.

Question: 9. Which of the following is very brittle?
Explanation: Explanation: Stellites are very brittle in nature. They even can’t be forged to shape.

Question: 10. Which of the following can machine the metals effectively?
Explanation: Explanation: Ceramics can machine hard metals effectively and also has higher compressive strength with negative rake. Diamonds are good for finishing work and also suitable for cutting hard materials.

Question: 1. Lathe cutting tool can be classified according to_____
Explanation: Explanation: Cutting tool can be classified according to all mentioned parameters. Generally in lathe we use single point cutting tools.

Question: 2. Which of the following cutting tool can have single roller?
Option C: c) both boring tool and knurling tool
Explanation: Explanation: Both boring tool and knurling tool can have single roller. Generally, boring tool is used to enlarge the hole. Knurling is used when we need a pattern of straight, cross and angular lines cutting each other.

Question: 3. Lathe cutting tool can be classified as right hand and left hand according to_______
Option A: a) method of using the tool
Option B: b) method of holding the tool
Explanation: Explanation: Lathe cutting tool can be classified as right hand and left hand according to method of applying feed. Here, feed is the distance the tool advances for each revolution of the work.

Question: 4. Which of the following is not the type of left hand type cutting tool?
Explanation: Explanation: All are the types of left hand cutting tool. Facing, roughing and finishing are one kind of turning operations often carried out on lathe.

Question: 5. According to the method of using the tool, lathe cutting tool can be classified as_______
Explanation: Explanation: According to the method of using the tool, lathe cutting tool can be classified as turning, grooving, forming, chamfering, internal thread cutting, parting-off and so on.

Question: 6. Which of the following is not the type of classification as per the method of manufacturing the tool?
Option A: a) tipped tool, which is brazed to the carbon steel shank
Option B: b) tipped tool, which is fastened mechanically to the carbon steel shank
Explanation: Explanation: Here, grooving is not the type of classification according to the method of manufacturing the tool. Grooving is the type of classification according to the method of using the tool.

Question: 7. “Tool bit inserted in the (tool) holder and solid tool” – is included in the classification according to the_____
Explanation: Explanation: All options are incorrect. Answer should be none of mentioned. It is suitable with the classification of cutting tool as per the method of holding the tool.

Question: 8. ‘Internal thread cutting’- is suitable with the classification of cutting tool according to the______
Option A: a) method of using the tool
Option B: b) method of holding the tool
Option C: c) method of manufacturing the tool
Explanation: Explanation: It can be easily seen from the classification of cutting tool. Apart from internal thread cutting, boring, facing, forming etc. are also included in this category.

Question: 9. ‘Round nose’ – is suitable with the classification of cutting tool according to the______
Option C: c) method of the applying feed
Explanation: Explanation: It can be easily understood by looking at the classification of cutting tool. Apart from round nose, right hand tool and left hand tool are also included in this category.

Question: 10. ‘Parting-off’ – is suitable with the classification of cutting tool according to the______
Option A: a) method of manufacturing the tool
Option B: b) method of holding the tool
Option C: c) method of using the tool
Explanation: Explanation: ‘Parting-off’ – is suitable with the classification of cutting tool according to the method of using the tool. This parting uses a blade like cutting tool into workpiece in order to cut the metal at the speed of spindle.

Question: 1. For lathe operations, work piece can be hold _____
Option C: c) either between centres or on mandrel
Explanation: Explanation: Work piece can be hold either between centers or on mandrel. Mandrels are used for holding hollow workpieces for turning concentric to the bore.

Question: 2. Which of the following is used to drive the work piece?
Option C: c) both carriers and catch plates
Explanation: Explanation: Work piece can be driven by using both of these. Catch plates are either screwed or bolted to the nose of the tailstock spindle while the carriers consists of a cast iron or forged steel body.

Question: 5. Grinding can be performed by______
Option A: a) using faceplates or angle plates
Explanation: Explanation: Grinding can be done by special attachments. Grinding is a type of machining using an abrasive type of wheel as the cutting tool.

Question: 6. Taper boring and the under boring can be performed by______
Option B: b) face plates or angle plates
Explanation: Explanation: Both types of plates can be used for this purpose. A face plate consists of a circular disk bored out and threaded to sit the nose of the lathe spindle while angel plate is a cast iron plate having two faces machined to make them absolutely at right angles to each other.

Question: 7. Milling can be performed by _____
Option B: b) face plates or angel plates
Explanation: Explanation: Milling can be performed by special attachments. Milling machine is a machine tool that removes metal as the work is fed against a rotating multipoint cutter.

Question: 8. Spinning can be done by_____
Option B: b) face plates or angle plates
Explanation: Explanation: This operation can be done by using centres. Spining winding is also done by this method.

Question: 9. Reaming and counter boring can be performed by______
Option B: b) face plates and angle plates
Explanation: Explanation: Both types of operations can be performed by using plates. Apart from that, parting off, internal thread cutting, undercutting are also performed by this method.

Question: 1. A taper may be defined as a uniform gradual_____ along the length of the job.
Explanation: Explanation: A taper may be defined as a uniform gradual increase or decrease along the length of the job.  Taper turning can be measured by from tool method, tailstock offset method, compound slide method and so on.

Question: 3. In a lathe, taper turning means to produce a_____ surface by gradually decreasing the value of diameter from a cylindrical work piece.
Option C: c) both conical and flat surface
Explanation: Explanation: Taper turning means to produce a conical surface by gradually decreasing the value of diameter from a cylindrical work  piece lathe. Two types of tapers are there: internal and external taper.

Question: 4. Which of the following is not true for taper turning?
Option A: a) taper turning is one type of lathe operation
Option B: b) the amount of taper is specified by the ratio of its length to the difference in the diameter of the taper
Option C: c) amount of taper is designated by the letter K
Explanation: Explanation: All the sentences are true except the sentence which says that the amount of taper is specified by the ratio of its length to the difference in the diameter of the taper. The amount of taper is specified by the ratio of difference in the diameters of the taper to its length.

Question: 6. The SI unit of taper is_____
Explanation: Explanation: Taper is ratio of same quantity. It is unitless.

Question: 8. Which of the following is the right formula for taper?
Explanation: Explanation: K= (D-d) / L – It is the basic formula used for calculating taper. Here k=taper, D and d are diameters and l is length.

Question: 9. Find the value of K. D= 90 mm, d=80 mm, L=1cm.
Explanation: Explanation:  1 cm = 10 mm. From the formula K= (D-d)/L, K can be easily calculated.

Question: 10. Find the value of d. K=1/10, L= 10 cm, D=65 mm.
Explanation: Explanation: Answer should be 55 mm. It can be easily calculated from the formula K= (D-d)/L.

Question: 1. Which of the following is not the method of taper turning?
Explanation: Explanation: All are methods of taper turning.By using compound rest method and and attachment method, both internal and external taper can be turned while tailstock offset method is used only for external tapers.

Question: 3. From tool method is generally used for_____ production for producing_____ length of taper.
Explanation: Explanation: This method is used for mass production for producing small length of taper.

Question: 6. In compound slide method, which of the following is swiveled?
Explanation: Explanation: Top slide is swiveled in this method. It is swiveled to half the included angel of the taper.

Question: 7. In compound slide method, one part of compound rest is swiveled to_____ the included angle of the taper.
Explanation: Explanation: In compound slide method, one part of compound rest is swiveled (at half the included angle of the taper). We can easily set this compound slide.

Question: 8. In compound rest method, the amount of taper for setting the angle is calculated from this formula, tan of angle of taper =_____
Explanation: Explanation: (D-d) / 4L – this is the formula for the tan of the angel of taper. Taper is the shape in which the diameter of the both ends are different.

Question: 9. Which type of tapers can be produced by using compound rest method?
Explanation: Explanation: Both internal and external taper can be produced by using compound slide method. But there is one disadvantage. We can only give hand feed so we can’t expect a high accurate and mass work.

Question: 10. Which of the following is not true for compound slide method?
Option A: a) threads, which are there on taper portion cannot be produced
Option B: b) steep taper cannot be produced
Option C: c) taper length is limited to the movement of the top slide
Explanation: Explanation: All mentioned sentences are true except the sentence which says that steep taper can’t produced by this method. Steep taper can be produced by this method.

Question: 11. In attachment method, the bar having graduations in degree is set at the_____ with the lathe axis.
Explanation: Explanation: The bar is set at any desired angle with the lathe axis. The principle of turning taper by attachment is to guide the tool in a straight path set an angel to the axis of rotation of the work piece, while the work is being revolved between centers or by a chuck aligned to the lathe axis.

Question: 12. In compound slide method, taper length is limited to the movement of_____
Explanation: Explanation: Taper length is limited to the movement of top slide in this method. Along with this, easily setting of the compound slide can be done easily.

Question: 13. The taper can be turned up to maximum setting angle of_____ for both outside and inside tapers with taper attachment and automatic feed.
Explanation: Explanation: The taper can be turned up to maximum setting angle of 10 to 12 degree for both outside and inside tapers with taper attachment and automatic feed.

Question: 15. Which of the following is not true for attachment method?
Option A: a) lengthy tapers can be produced
Option B: b) the alignment of the lathe center is disturbed
Option C: c) power feed can be given
Explanation: Explanation: All the sentences are true except the sentence which says that the alignment of the lathe center is disturbed. The alignment of the lathe center is not disturbed in attachment method.

Question: 1. In tailstock offset method, the job is held at an angle and the tool moves______ to the axis.
Explanation: Explanation: The tool moves parallel to the axis in this method. the body of the tailstock is shifted on its base to an amount corresponding to the angle of taper.

Question: 2. In tailstock method, the angle at which the axis of rotation of the job is shifted is equal to______ the angle of taper.
Explanation: Explanation: This is angle is equal to half the angle of taper. This taper can be turned between centers only.

Question: 3. In tailstock method, body of the tailstock is made to slide on its base_____ from the operation.
Explanation: Explanation: In tailstock method, body of the tailstock is made to slide on its base either away or towards from the operation. This operation is done with the help of setover screw.

Question: 5. Which type of taper is generally turned in tailstock method?
Explanation: Explanation: Only external taper can be turned in this method. Generally for internal threads this method is not used.

Question: 6. Which of the following is not true for tailstock method?
Option A: a) the body of tailstock is shifted on its base to an amount corresponding to the angle of taper
Option B: b) the movement of tailstock is made by a setover screw
Option C: c) accurate setting of the offset is easy
Explanation: Explanation: All the mentioned sentences are true except one which says that accurate setting of the offset is easy. Actually, accurate setting of the offset is difficult in this method.

Question: 7. Which of the following is not true for tailstock method?
Option A: a) the taper can be turned between centres only
Option B: b) duplicate tapers can be produced
Option C: c) the alignment of the lathe centres will be disturbed
Explanation: Explanation: All the above sentences are true. These all sentences are related with tailstock method  in which the maximum length of the taper can be produced.

Question: 8. Which of the following is the benefit of tailstock method?
Option A: a) power feed can be given
Option B: b) good surface finish can be obtained
Option C: c) maximum length of the taper can be produced
Explanation: Explanation: These all are the benefits of the tailstock method. Apart from these benefits, we have some other benefits too like external threads on taper portion can be produced, duplicate tapers can be produced and so on.

Question: 10. The taper turning attachment consists essentially of a frame which is attached to the_____ end of the lathe bed.
Explanation: Explanation: The taper turning attachment consists essentially of a frame which is attached to the rear end of the lathe bed. This attachment is provided only on a few modern lathes.

Question: 12. In attachment method, cross-slide must be made_____ the lead screw.
Explanation: Explanation: Cross slide must be made free from the lead screw in this method. The tool mounted on the cross-slide will follow the angular path.

Question: 13. Which type of tapers can be produced by attachment method?
Explanation: Explanation: Both types of tapers can be produced by attachment method. Apart from this, good surface finish is also obtained as well as the alignment of the lathe centers is not disturbed.

Question: 14. In attachment method, the angle of swiveling the guide bar can be determined from this equation, tan of angle =______
Explanation: Explanation: Here, D and d denotes diameters and L denotes length. The tan of angel is also known as the angel of swiveling the guide bar.

Question: 2. The lead screw obtains_____ motion from the working spindle.
Explanation: Explanation: The lead screw obtains rotary motion from the working spindle. The lead screw drives the tool post axially against the workpiece to produce a helical groove.

Question: 3. The _____ motion is converted into_____ motion of the tool slide
Explanation: Explanation: The rotary motion is converted into feed motion. The ledscrew has a trapezoidal thread and obtains this rotary motion which converts into feed motion by split.

Question: 4. The split is mounted in the_____ of the carriage.
Explanation: Explanation: It can be easily seen from the construction of the carriage. The apron is fastened to the saddle and hangs over the front of the bed.

Question: 5. In thread cutting, which type of feed motion is possible?
Explanation: Explanation: Both types of feed motion is possible in thread cutting. In order to perform these feed motions split nut’s movement is required.

Question: 6. In thread cutting, the _____ feeds should be equal to the pitch of the thread, which is to be cut per revolution of the work piece.
Explanation: Explanation: This is the definition of the longitudinal feeds. Again here the feed is the distance the tool advances for each revolution of work.

Question: 7. In thread cutting, which of the following receives traversing motion from the lead screw of the lathe?
Explanation: Explanation: Saddle receives traversing motion from the lead screw of the lathe, This leadscrew has a definite pitch.

Question: 8. In thread cutting, definite ratio is calculated between the_____ feed and rotation of the_____ spindle.
Explanation: Explanation: The definite ratio is calculated between the longitudinal type of feed and the rotation of the headstock spindle. This ratio should be found out so that the relative speeds of rotation of the work and the leadscrew will result in the cutting of a screw of the desired pitch.

Question: 9. Which of the following is not true for thread cutting?
Option A: a) tool post is driven by lead screw axially against the work piece
Option B: b) the lead screw has a trapezoidal thread
Option C: c) the relative type of speeds of  rotation of the work and the lead screw can result in the cutting of a screw of the desired pitch
Explanation: Explanation: All the sentences are true. These all mentioned sentences are the related with the working of the thread cutting which can be carried on a lathe to obtain standard forms and properties of screw threads by using appropriate tools.

Question: 10. In thread chasing dial, the half nut is_____ when any live on the dial coincides with a reference live already set.
Option C: c) partially opened and partially closed
Explanation: Explanation: At this condition, the half nut is closed to avoid collision. Thread chasing dial is a special attachment used in cutting threads.

Question: 11. In thread chasing dial, half nut is closed when any numbered live coincides with reference live for_____ thread.
Explanation: Explanation: In thread chasing dial, half nut is closed when any numbered live coincides with reference live for odd thread. The dial indicates when to close the split nut.

Question: 12. The chasing dial is mounted on the right end of the _____
Explanation: Explanation: The chasing dial is mounted on the right end of the apron. This chasing dial is generally used to pick up the thread.

Question: 13. In chasing dial, dial rotate as long as the half nut is_____
Option C: c) either engaged or not engaged
Explanation: Explanation: In chasing dial, dial rotate as long as the half nut is not engaged. Dial stops when the half nut is engaged.

Question: 15. For feed motion, split nut has to be_____
Option C: c) either opened or closed (depend upon motion)
Explanation: Explanation: Split nut may be open or close depends upon the situations. This is done in order to engage or disengage the feed motion.

Question: 2. The gear connections on a lathe______
Option C: c) may be simple or compound
Explanation: Explanation: The gear connection on a lathe may be simple or compound depends upon the requirement. It is versatile.

Question: 3. The gear on the stud shaft acts as a _____
Explanation: Explanation: The gear on the stud shaft act as a driver. It can be considered as spindle gear as usually it runs at the same spindle speed.

Question: 4. Which of the following is also known as Norton gearbox?
Option C: c) quick change type of gearbox
Explanation: Explanation: Quick change type of gearbox is also known as Norton gearbox. It covers all the ratio of screw cutting and feed rate likely to be wanted.

Question: 5. In Norton gearbox, gear changing is effected by the movement of_____ levers.
Explanation: Explanation: Gear changing is affected by the movements of two levers as well as a sliding gear. This eliminates the need to remove and change the gears as in the standard change gearbox.

Question: 6. Teeth on driven gear / teeth on driver gear =_______ T.P.I on lead screw=a, T.P.I. on work piece=b.
Explanation: Explanation: (b/a) – This is the suitable ratio for threads where T.P.I on lead screw=a, T.P.I. on work piece=b. If the units of workpiece and leadscrew threads are different, in that case the gears are calculated as follows: 1 inch = 25.4 mm.

Question: 7. Driver gear/driven gear =______ pitch of work piece threads=a, pitch of lead screw =b.
Explanation: Explanation: It is the suitable ratio. In British it will be equal to (a/b)*(5/127).

Question: 8. Lead screw pitch=6mm, work piece pitch=1mm. Find change gears.
Explanation: Explanation: Change gear=work piece pitch/lead screw pitch. From this formula, we can easily get 1/6 as a answer.

Question: 9. Change gear=2, lead screw pitch = 8. Find work piece pitch.
Explanation: Explanation: Change gear=work piece pitch/lead screw pitch. So, work piece pitch = change gear*lead screw pitch                     = 2*8                     = 16

Question: 10. In a compound train, the stud carriers______ gears.
Explanation: Explanation: The stud carriers two gears. The gear on the stud shaft act as a driver.

Question: 1. ______ is the speed at which the metal is removed by the tool from the work piece.
Explanation: Explanation: It can be easily understood by looking at the definition of the cutting speed. Cutting speed is a peripheral speed of the work.

Question: 2. Which of the following represents the formula for cutting speed? cs =cutting speed, D= diameter of work, N= rpm.
Explanation: Explanation: Cs = (3.14*D*N) – This is the formula for finding the cutting speed.

Question: 3. Which of the following represent the unit of cutting speed?
Explanation: Explanation: In cutting speed’s formula, d-diameter expressed in meter and n is rpm – revolution per minute. By putting this units in cutting speed’s formula, we can easily obtain its unit as meter/minute.

Question: 4. _____ is the distance the tool advances for each revolution of the work.
Explanation: Explanation: The feed of a cutting tool in a lathe work is the distance the tool advances for each revolution of the work. Increased feed reduces the cutting time.

Question: 5. Which of the following is the unit of the feed?
Explanation: Explanation: Mm / revolution is the right unit for feed. In British system it is expressed in inches per revolution.

Question: 6. The depth of cut is the_____ distance measured from the machined surface to the surface of the work piece, which is uncut.
Explanation: Explanation: It is the perpendicular distance measured from the machined surface to the surface of the work piece, which is uncut. Other factors remaining constant, the depth of cut varies inversely as the cutting speed.

Question: 7. Which of the following represents the formula for the depth of cut? d1=diameter of work surface before machining and d2=diameter of the machined surface
Explanation: Explanation: (D1-d2) – this is the formula for depth of cut. Here both d1 and d2 are diameters and expressed in mm.

Question: 8. Which of the following represents the formula for metal removal rate?
Option A: a=cutting speed, b=depth of cut, c=feed, d=revolution
Explanation: Explanation: (a*b*c)/d – This is the right formula for metal removal rate. Here a is expressed in mm/minute, b is expressed in mm, c is expressed in mm/revolution and d is simply revolution.

Question: 9. Which of the following represents the unit of metal removal rate?
Explanation: Explanation: Mm*mm*mm / revolution is the right unit for the metal removal rate. If we put the units of cutting speed, depth of cut and feed in formula we can easily get this result.

Question: 10. Which of the following represents the unit for machining time?
Explanation: Explanation: Machining time is simply a time so its unit must be matched with time’s unit. Minute is the right unit for machining time.

Question: 11. Which of the following represents the formula for the machining time? s=feed of the job per revolution, l=length of the job, n=rpm.
Explanation: Explanation: Length of the job / (feed of the job per revolution*rpm) is the right for machining time. Also we can cross check the formula. Put the unit of each quantity and check in which formula we can get unit as a time’s unit.

Question: 12. For general purposes, ratio of the depth of cut to the feed varies from_____
Explanation: Explanation: The ratio varies from 10:1. The depth of cut varies inversely as the cutting speed.

Question: 1. The various milling process may be classified in ______ categories.
Explanation: Explanation: Various milling process may be classified in 2 categories: peripheral milling and face milling.

Question: 2. Upmilling and downmilling are the subtype of ________ milling process.
Option C: c) both peripheral milling and face milling
Explanation: Explanation: Peripheral milling is the type of milling in which produced machine surface remains parallel to the axis of cutter.

Question: 3. Which of the following milling is known as conventional milling?
Explanation: Explanation: Up milling is also known as conventional milling as in this process metal is removed by cutter which rotates in the opposite direction of the travel of the work piece.

Question: 4. Which of the following process is also known as climb milling?
Explanation: Explanation: Down milling is also known as climb milling as in this process metal is removed by cutter which rotates in the same direction of the travel of the work piece.

Question: 5. The thickness of the chip in upmilling is _______  at the beginning of the cut.
Explanation: Explanation: As per the working of the upmilling, at the begining the the thickness of chip is minimum as cutting force vary from zero to maximum in upmilling. So intially thickness of chip is minimum.

Question: 6. The thickness of the chip in upmilling is _______ in when the cut terminates.
Explanation: Explanation: The cutting force vary from zero to maximum in up milling. At the end due to maximum force chip thickness is high.

Explanation: Explanation: This is the disadvantage of this process. The extra clamping forces may be required to fix the job on the table.

Question: 2. The work is pulled by cutter teeth and hence the job may get spoiled or breakaway. This is the disadvantage of _____ process.

Explanation: Explanation: From the working of downmilling, the cutting force vary from maximum to zero. So at the end thickness of chip is minimum.

Explanation: Explanation: Rigid machines are used in this process so that no clamping difficulty is there in downmilling.
